## Esna 137 {-}  
  
- Location: Intercolumnar Wall B, lower bandeau (below [Esna 136])   
- Date: Uncertain  
- [Hieroglyphic Text](https://www.ifao.egnet.net/uploads/publications/enligne/Temples-Esna002.pdf#page=321){target="_blank"}  
- Bibliography: @elgawady, p. 202.

<div class="col2">  
  
*[...n]fr ḥr ỉfdw=f  *  
    *ỉn sšȝ.t pḏ-sšr  *  
*nbỉ n ẖnmw m ʿ.wy=f ḏs=f  *  
*rsy-ỉnb=f ḥr swȝḥ=f  *  
*ḫwsỉ ỉn šw  *  
*ḫtỉ(?) m sš.w   *  
  *n ḏḥwty m ḏbʿ.w=f  *  
*nḫb ḥr=f  *  
  
[...g]ood [...] upon its four corners,  
    by Seshat who stretched the cord,[^fn-137-1]  
fashioned by Khnum with his own hands,  
Resy-inebef (Ptah) makes it stable,  
being founded by Shu,  
inscribed(?) with the writings  
  of Thoth with his fingers,  
dedications are on it [^fn-137-2]  
  
</div>  
  
[^fn-137-1]: This is the scene represented immediately above: [Esna 136].  
[^fn-137-2]: The text continues immediately in [Esna 142]. The translation of these final signs was suggested by Daniel Arpagaus.
